channel.title: I can't understand this phrase: "endemic social conflicts"
channel.description:
[size=14pt]The whole sentence is: "The primary reason for these French failures was internal disunity caused by [b]endemic social conflicts[/b].[/size]
I have search the definition of each word, and tried to put the meanings together, but I am still having trouble figuring out what that means.

item.title: I can't understand this phrase: "endemic social conflicts"
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

“the primary reason for these french (as in a french community?) failures was internal disunity caused by endemic (local, as in the community) social conflicts”

if looking up the dictionary definition doesn’t help you can try checking a thesaurus

Read full topic
item.source: I can't understand this phrase: "endemic social conflicts"

item.title: I can't understand this phrase: "endemic social conflicts"
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

They tore themselves apart because they were having social conflicts in their own native area/country between each other, depending on the rest of the text.
